pullRequest.body:
Add one lemma stating that an element is a unit if and only if its image through a ring equivalence is a unit.

---

nodes.body: ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8262949724/job/22603361881)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8262949724/job/22603362370)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8262949724/job/22603362099)
Can we state this more generally for `MulEquivClass`?

Well, we can for `MonoidHomClass` because `IsUnit` is not defined for `Mul` classes.

I did it above, and am not very happy about putting this theorem here. I tried to put it inside `Group\Equiv\Basic.lean`, where I think it should belong, but this creates import loops.
This presumably doesn't belong in this file any more, since it is not about rings.
I agree, but as I said in a reply to your previous comment, I tried to put it inside `Group\Equiv\Basic.lean`, where I think it should belong, but this creates import loops.

This one definitely shouldn't be in the RingEquiv namespace; MulEquiv could be acceptable. In analogy to [isUnit_map_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Ideal/LocalRing.html#isUnit_map_iff) (which is for local ring homs), we should swap the two sides and align the name:
```
theorem map_isUnit_iff {M N} [Monoid M] [Monoid N] [EquivLike F M N] [MonoidHomClass F M N]
    (f : F) {m : M} : IsUnit (f m) â†” IsUnit m :=
  isUnit_map_of_leftInverse (MonoidHom.inverse (f : M â†’* N) (EquivLike.inv f)
    (EquivLike.left_inv f) <| EquivLike.right_inv f) (EquivLike.left_inv f)
```
#find_home says it can go into Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Units.Equiv. I think MulHomClass also works but we can't use `isUnit_map_of_leftInverse` with it.
OK, I have changed it accordingly and moved it there.
It seems useless, but if you want I add it back. Apart from this, do you think that the PR is ready to go?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Ring/Equiv): add lemma isUnit_iff
